events.name: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_label: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.
events.description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

events.name: Griner's Detention and Release
events.wd_description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.
events.description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.

events.name: Viktor Bout's Release
events.wd_description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.
events.description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.

events.name: Diplomatic Tensions and Negotiations
events.wd_description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.
events.description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.

events.name: Yevgeny Prigozhin Admits Interference in US Elections
events.wd_label: Yevgeny Prigozhin Admits Interference in US Elections
events.wd_description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, a powerful Russian businessman and ally of President Vladimir Putin, admitted to interfering in US elections on the eve of the midterm vote, a claim acknowledged by the White House.
events.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, a powerful Russian businessman and ally of President Vladimir Putin, admitted to interfering in US elections on the eve of the midterm vote, a claim acknowledged by the White House.

events.name: Prigozhin's Admission
events.wd_description: Yevgeny Prigozhin admitted to interfering in US elections, stating that they have interfered, are interfering, and will continue to interfere.
events.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin admitted to interfering in US elections, stating that they have interfered, are interfering, and will continue to interfere.

events.name: White House Response
events.wd_description: The White House, through spokesperson Karine Jean-Pierre, responded to Prigozhin's remarks, noting that his activities to influence elections are well-documented.
events.description: The White House, through spokesperson Karine Jean-Pierre, responded to Prigozhin's remarks, noting that his activities to influence elections are well-documented.

events.name: Midterm Election Context
events.wd_description: Prigozhin's admission came on the eve of the US midterm elections, in which Republicans are seeking to take control of Congress and state-wide offices.
events.description: Prigozhin's admission came on the eve of the US midterm elections, in which Republicans are seeking to take control of Congress and state-wide offices.

events.name: Designation of Ibrahim Traore as Transitional President of Burkina Faso
events.wd_label: Designation of Ibrahim Traore as Transitional President of Burkina Faso
events.wd_description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially designated as Burkina Faso's transitional President, following a coup he led, with plans to return the country to constitutional rule by 2024.
events.description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially designated as Burkina Faso's transitional President, following a coup he led, with plans to return the country to constitutional rule by 2024.

events.name: Designation of Traore
events.wd_description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially named the transitional President of Burkina Faso, following the second coup in the country this year.
events.description: Army captain Ibrahim Traore was officially named the transitional President of Burkina Faso, following the second coup in the country this year.

events.name: Transitional Government Plans
events.wd_description: Around 300 officials in Ouagadougou discussed plans to return Burkina Faso to constitutional rule by July 2024, as agreed with ECOWAS.
events.description: Around 300 officials in Ouagadougou discussed plans to return Burkina Faso to constitutional rule by July 2024, as agreed with ECOWAS.

events.name: Ongoing Insurgency
events.wd_description: Burkina Faso continues to battle a violent insurgency linked to Al Qaeda and Islamic State, which has caused thousands of deaths and nearly two million displacements.
events.description: Burkina Faso continues to battle a violent insurgency linked to Al Qaeda and Islamic State, which has caused thousands of deaths and nearly two million displacements.

events.name: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.
events.description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.

events.name: Grant Announcements
events.wd_description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.
events.description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.

events.name: Projects and Investments
events.wd_description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.
events.description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.

events.name: American Battery Technology Project
events.wd_description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.
events.description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.

events.name: Cirba Solutions Project
events.wd_description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.
events.description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.

events.name: Ascend Elements Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.
events.description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.

events.name: Albemarle Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.
events.description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.

events.name: Anovion Project
events.wd_description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.
events.description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.

events.name: American Battery Materials Initiative
events.wd_description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
events.description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
